text:
(1) Leonard Street, west from and including Baxter Street, showing (left), The Tombs Prison(fortress like building with tower), occupying the block from Centre to Lafayette Streets. Also shown is Baxter Street, west side, north from and including Leonard, to, but not including Franklin Streets. The south side of Leonard, from Baxter to Centre Streets, is an empty lot and is used for parking automobiles, and at the extreme right are visible trees from Columbus Park.

September 24, 1927.

P. L. Sperr.

(2) A view at a later date, showing in addition the north side of the New York State Office Building on the south side of Leonard Street. West of same appears a portion of the new Department of Health, Hospitals and Sanitation Building. The factory buildings appearing on the right will be demolished and upon their site will rise a unit of the new Criminal Courts Building replacing the old structure and the Tombs.

November 6, 1937.

P. L. Sperr.

(1) Leonard Street, west from and including Baxter Street, showing (left), The Tombs Prison(fortress like building with tower), occupying the block from Centre to Lafayette Streets. Also shown is Baxter Street, west side, north from and including Leonard, to, but not including Franklin Streets. The south side of Leonard, from Baxter to Centre Streets, is an empty lot and is used for parking automobiles, and at the extreme right are visible trees from Columbus Park.

September 24, 1927.

P. L. Sperr.

(2) A view at a later date, showing in addition the north side of the New York State Office Building on the south side of Leonard Street. West of same appears a portion of the new Department of Health, Hospitals and Sanitation Building. The factory buildings appearing on the right will be demolished and upon their site will rise a unit of the new Criminal Courts Building replacing the old structure and the Tombs.

November 6, 1937.

P. L. Sperr.

(1) Baxter Street, west side, north from Leonard (extreme left, not shown), and across Franklin (center) Streets, showing buildings at the corners of the latter point about to be demolished. Two entire blocks will eventually fall here and upon their sites will rise a new Criminal Courts Building, replacing the old structure on Center Street. Note at the right, the western edge of Columbus Park.

February 5, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.

(2) A latter view from Franklin Street, showing the buildings at the N.W. corner already down, with the balance about to fall. The 10 and 12 story loft buildings seen across same are No's. 124-28-32 White Street.

April 23, 1938.
P. L. Sperr.

(3) A northwestward view from the same vantage point as the preceding view. The lone building appearing on the north side of Franklin Street is Fire Patrol No. 1. To the left, appears the about to be replaced Criminal Courts Building.

April 23, 1938.
P. L. Sperr.

Baxter Street, north from Leonard (left) to Franklin (right) Streets, showing under demolition a complete block of structures, to provide 1/2 of the site for the new Criminal Courts Bldg. and prison. To the left, on Center Street, appears a corner of the about to be replaced Tombs prison:

The photographer is viewing westward in No. 1 and northward in 2 and 3. Note in the latter, progress made in one month. For an account of this public work, see page 21 of the New York Times of Mar. 1, 1938.

March 11, 1938
Views 1 and 2
View 2: April 23, 1938.

The photographer is viewing westward in No. 1 and northward in 2 and 3. Note in the latter, progress made in one month. For an account of this public work, see page 21 of the New York Times of Mar. 1, 1938.
